org.usfirst.frc2084.CMonster2014.drive

Class MecanumDriveAlgorithm

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.usfirst.frc2084.CMonster2014.drive.DriveAlgorithm
      • org.usfirst.frc2084.CMonster2014.drive.MecanumDriveAlgorithm

  • public class MecanumDriveAlgorithm
extends DriveAlgorithm
    A DriveAlgorithm that uses a FourWheelDriveController (which controls four mecanum wheels) to drive using a gyro to maintain orientation and drive relative to the field. Mecanum wheels have rollers set at a 45 degree angle from the wheel's direction of rotation. This allows them the robot to move in any direction.
    Author:
    Ben Wolsieffer
    See Also:
    FourWheelDriveController, DriveAlgorithm

      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected FourWheelDriveController controller
      The MecanumDriveAlgorithm requires a FourWheelDriveController so the normal DriveAlgorithm.controller is hidden.
      protected edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Gyro gyro
      The Gyro that the MecanumDriveAlgorithm uses for field-oriented driving and keeping the correct orientation.

      The derivative constant of the PID algorithm.

      The feed-forward constant of the PID algorithm.
      static double ROTATION_I
      The integral constant of the PID algorithm.
      static double ROTATION_P
      The proportional constant of the PID algorithm.

    • Field Detail

      • controller

        protected final FourWheelDriveController controller
        The MecanumDriveAlgorithm requires a FourWheelDriveController so the normal DriveAlgorithm.controller is hidden.

      • gyro

        protected final edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Gyro gyro
        The Gyro that the MecanumDriveAlgorithm uses for field-oriented driving and keeping the correct orientation.

      • ROTATION_DEADBAND

        public final double ROTATION_DEADBAND
        The rotation speed below which the rotation PID controller is enabled. When the rotation speed increases above this value the controller is disabled to allow the robot to turn.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ROTATION_P

        public static final double ROTATION_P
        The proportional constant of the PID algorithm. This value is multiplied by the error.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ROTATION_I

        public static final double ROTATION_I
        The integral constant of the PID algorithm. This value is multiplied by the sum of the error over time. This is used to make the robot turn more if it is taking a long time to reach its target.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ROTATION_D

        public static final double ROTATION_D
        The derivative constant of the PID algorithm. This value is multiplied by the rate of change of the error.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • ROTATION_F

        public static final double ROTATION_F
        The feed-forward constant of the PID algorithm. This value seems to be multiplied by the setpoint, which doesn't make much sense. I don't really know what it is supposed to do so I just leave it at 0.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • MecanumDriveAlgorithm

        public MecanumDriveAlgorithm(FourWheelDriveController controller,
                             edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.Gyro gyro)
        Creates a new MecanumDriveAlgorithm that controls the specified FourWheelDriveController.
        Parameters:
        controller - the FourWheelDriveController to control
        gyro - the Gyro to use for orientation correction and field-oriented driving

    • Method Detail

      • mecanumDrive_Cartesian

        public void mecanumDrive_Cartesian(double x,
                                   double y,
                                   double rotation,
                                   double gyroAngle)
        Moves the robot forward and sideways while rotating at the specified speeds. This method uses the specified angle to implement field oriented controls.
        Parameters:
        x - The forward speed (negative = backward, positive = forward)
        y - The sideways (crab) speed (negative = left, positive = right)
        rotation - The speed to rotate at while moving (negative = clockwise, positive = counterclockwise)
        gyroAngle - the current angle reading from the gyro

      • mecanumDrive_Cartesian

        public void mecanumDrive_Cartesian(double x,
                                   double y,
                                   double rotation)
        Moves the robot forward and sideways while rotating at the specified speeds. This moves the robot relative to the robot's current orientation.
        Parameters:
        x - The forward speed (negative = backward, positive = forward)
        y - The sideways (crab) speed (negative = left, positive = right)
        rotation - The speed to rotate at while moving (negative = clockwise, positive = counterclockwise)

      • mecanumDrive_Orientation

        public void mecanumDrive_Orientation(double x,
                                     double y,
                                     double angle)

      • mecanumDrive_Polar

        public void mecanumDrive_Polar(double magnitude,
                               double direction,
                               double rotation)
        Drives the robot at the specified speed in the direction specified as an angle in degrees while rotating. This does not take into account the gyro correction yet because we do not use it.
        Parameters:
        magnitude - The speed that the robot should drive in a given direction.
        direction - the direction the robot should drive in degrees, independent of rotation
        rotation - The rate of rotation for the robot that is completely independent of the magnitude or direction. [-1.0..1.0]

      • mecanumDrive_Cartesian

        public void mecanumDrive_Cartesian(edu.wpi.first.wpilibj.GenericHID stick)
        Drive based on the specified joystick using the x and y axes.
        Parameters:
        stick - The joystick to use

      • mecanumDrive_Cartesian

        public void mecanumDrive_Cartesian(double x,
                                   double y)
        Moves the robot forward and sideways at the specified speeds.
        Parameters:
        x - The forward speed (negative = backward, positive = forward)
        y - The sideways (crab) speed (negative = left, positive = right)

      • crab

        public void crab(double speed)
        Moves the robot sideways at the specified speed.
        Parameters:
        speed - The speed and direction to crab (negative = left, positive = right)

      • resetGyro

        public void resetGyro()
        Resets the robot's gyro value to zero and resets the PID controller error. This is usually called on command, or after the robot has been disabled to get rid of drift.
